page.title: 14 Industry in Aldridge
page.content: The past industrial development of the area has been associated with the exploitation of minerals. With the using up of the richer coal seams in about 1900, coal and iron industries ceased to be of major importance. Limestone working was discontinued in the 1930's. At Stubbers Green Aldridge however Brick and Tile manufacture remains an important industry. Around Linley Wood and Stubbers Green large areas of deeply scarred waste land give evidence of the towns past. From the 1950's onwards industrial estates have developed bringing precision engineering, plastics and machine tools into the area. The most recent development has been a large factory estate built between Northgate and Stubbers Green. This is made up mainly of service industries and warehousing and distribution facilities.
